main event: Four objects were observed in Fitchburg, Massachusetts, on January 16, 1961, during a ground-radar observation where they appeared and disappeared in an irregular pattern.
interesting points: The sighting lasted less than 2 minutes and involved radar readings and observations by a total of 2 RAD-50 High Altitude Maneuvers,The objects were under observation by an amateur astronomer and his son,The larger object appeared as large as a dime held at arm's length,The objects maneuvered in a four-foot square area,The larger object shot off at high speed while the smaller objects remained visible for several minutes after.
witness description: an amateur astronomer and his son
